newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Amaps makes strong debut on S.Africa JSE.
newsitem.headline: Amaps makes strong debut on S.Africa JSE.

text.p: South African electrical goods firm, Amalgamated Appliances Holdings Ltd (Amaps), made a robust debut on the Johannesburg Stock Exchange on Thursday amid perceptions the company held strong potential.
"There is lots of buying interest in the share. There is good demand at 160 cents," a dealer said.
By 0820 GMT The company was the most actively traded share on the exchange with 3.6 million shares worth over 6.1 million rand traded.
It was last changing hands at 164 cents after reaching a high of 178 cents in early trade. A range of 164-168 cents was seen on the day.
Dealers said the firm's share offer had attracted keen interest, being 38 times oversubscribed.
The company said earlier earnings in the current financial year were expected to rise 44 percent to a proforma 8.2 million rand or 8.6 cents.
A further 44 percent increase in earnings was expected in the 1998 financial year
The company earlier said it expected to benefit from strong demand growth in the 500 million rand a year small appliance market.

"Emerging consumers are the backbone of demand in this industry and with half a million new customers a year expected for our products, we have built a strategy to secure competitive advantage through both low cost operation and production differentiation," it said.
The company's portfolio of appliance brands includes Salton, Tedelex, Sanyo, Hoover and Rowenta.
